name: Begonia kingiana
description: Begonia kingiana is a terrestrial plant native to tropical regions of Myanmar (Burma). It belongs to the Begoniaceae family and features upright stems (30-60 cm tall) with large, asymmetrical, dark green leaves with distinctive patterns and markings. The plant displays an upright, bushy growth habit. Leaves often feature striking patterns including spirals, spots, stripes, and iridescent sheens, with some species having translucent "windows" in their leaves. In its native habitat, it grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds natural beauty with its distinctive foliage. It's popular among Begonia enthusiasts for its attractive leaves.
careTips: Keep soil moist but not soggy
Bright indirect light - avoid direct sun
